page.title: 17Durlston Bay Area
page.content: This area south of the town of Swanage, sits on a chalk and sandstone ridge. It is mainly residential. There are small hotels and guest houses too. Many of the houses are large and detached with considerable grounds, which are beautifully kept. Some are newly built of stone these are in the main bungalows. Towards Durlston Bay there is erosion of the cliff and several buildings have fallen into the sea. A regular bus service provides public transport from the town of Swanage to this area; although private cars are the most common form of transport.
